text: Saverne is a commune in north-eastern France, in the Bas-Rhin department, of which it is a subprefecture. It is in the Grand Est region. The commmune is in the historical and cultural region of Alsace. ==Geography== Saverne is in the west of the Bas-Rhin department, to the west of Strasbourg. The Marne–Rhine Canal flows through the city of Saverne. The Zorn river, a right tributary of the Moder river, flows through the commune. The commune has an area of . Its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . The distances from Saverne to other cities are: * Paris, the national capital - ; * Strasbourg, the regional capital - ; * Marseille - ; * Lyon - ; * Reims - ; * Bordeaux - ; * Toulouse - ; * Montpellier - ; * Nice - . Saverne and its neighboring communes The commune of Saverne is surrounded by the following communes: ===Climate=== The climate of Saverne, in the Köppen climate classification, is Cfb - Oceanic climate with template summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Saverne are known, in French, as Savernois (women: Savernoises). With a population of 11,433, Saverne has a population density of inhabitants/km2. It is the capital of the Saverne arrondissement and is also the administrative centre () of the canton of Saverne formed by 49 communes, with 49,469 inhabitants (2014). === Twin towns === Saverne is twinned withː * Donaueschingen, Germany, since 1964 * Leominster, England, since 1992 * Pokrov, Russia, since 2003 ==Gallery== File:Saverne - hôtel de ville.JPG|Town hall of Saverne.
